body: OK, I will try my best to reduce the impact of performance.
I reworded some of the document to highlight the satellite, as we discussed, Satellite is actually a mandatory/recommended in product env.
Thanks for helping to modify the document.
I will update the website manually after this gets merged.
Fixed by https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/80
It's OK for me to (or not to) include this in 8.9.0
As it is potential, let's add it to next iteration. :)
Version change gets merged. Please resolve conflicts.

That is why I am very concerned about this, users will begin to abuse about this kind of tag. 
SkyWalking is not dealing with tenancy or cross clusters, because no concept about this, both UI and community don't support that.
So, I would like to call for a hold about this.

In the next few days, I am going to write a fully proposal about new v9.0.0 core and next booster UI (@Fine0830 leads). We are still not having plans about tenancy and cross clusters, because those two will introduce many management concepts, which are different in different countries and companies.

So, let's not push the project to a hard-to-all-users but convince-for-small-group status. SkyWalking is already a huge project, we encourage `upstream first` policy for common use cases, but it makes sense users have their forks and extensions.
Service name is unique, period. All other information is attachment.
@wu-sheng So should I pause this issue?

I would recommend to keep this in the discussion channel for now. I am not so confident about how the community would use this. I am concerned we will be blamed due to performance impact and more customization.
OK, I will suspend development and let's take a look at the community discussion on this.

>  I had searched in the issues and found no similar feature requirement.

You at least should do this. And read documents.

@wu-sheng  I have submitted a pr in opentelemetry https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/pull/6528. Gauge, Sum, Histogram have been supported. However, the Summary type is not yet supported for two reasons:  1. Protocol does not support summary  2. Mal does not support summary

Thanks. And yes, we don't support summary directly. 
We supported this in OAP Prometheus fetcher by using 2 guage metrics instead of a new type.

> Thanks. And yes, we don't support summary directly. We supported this in OAP Prometheus fetcher by using 2 guage metrics instead of a new type.

@wu-sheng 
I saw the conversion of the Summary type to the `quantile` tag data in the `PrometheusMetricConverter`, but at present I have not found a way to deal with this kind of data in the SampleFamily. The other two guage metrics should be count and sum.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16935891/144795029-25632c4a-b7df-498b-aea8-fd9254443a91.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16935891/144795466-5381cecd-ad91-4b98-b947-2827e769b903.png)
Could you be more clear about what you can't do in SampleFamily?

> Could you be more clear about what you can't do in SampleFamily?

@wu-sheng We converted the Histogram data into the data of the `le` label. There is a method histogram in mal to process the data of this kind of `le` label. There is no similar processing method for the data of the `quantile` label.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16935891/144797063-2fbad00a-139b-436a-9d21-0a3790c5f056.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16935891/144797354-1e837413-78a3-48e0-9828-0d1320b37309.png)

The codes of Prometheus fetcher was added first, but little used because most use OpenTelemetry collector or Satellite to do that. So, you could add `quantile` tag in the exporter directly. MAL doesn't have to be aware of this tag in the kernel level, the people writing MAL script knowing this should be enough. You could put this kind of `added-tags` logics in the document.

> The codes of Prometheus fetcher was added first, but little used because most use OpenTelemetry collector or Satellite to do that. So, you could add `quantile` tag in the exporter directly. MAL doesn't have to be aware of this tag in the kernel level, the people writing MAL script knowing this should be enough. You could put this kind of `added-tags` logics in the document.

Ok, I will put the label directly.

> > The codes of Prometheus fetcher was added first, but little used because most use OpenTelemetry collector or Satellite to do that. So, you could add `quantile` tag in the exporter directly. MAL doesn't have to be aware of this tag in the kernel level, the people writing MAL script knowing this should be enough. You could put this kind of `added-tags` logics in the document.

> Ok, I will put the label directly.

Thanks. Later(after that gets merged), we could discuss where we should describe these labels in the documents. I think you have seen the v9 is coming, so, we have enough time about this new input.

> Maintain a consistent version and no security breach in the final version

This would not be going to happen. This is an open source project, you have all rights to open fork or change the dependency privately.

the netty version is 4.1.68.Final in 8.9.0 and master branch, we typically won't back port CVEs to all previous versions, instead, we encourage users to upgrade to the latest SkyWalking if possible

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/1fdf3a8acf0b86be276d4a6cd288ae9c23e9aa42/oap-server-bom/pom.xml#L63

UPDATE:

Sorry didn't notice what you said agent side, and yes it's still 4.1.51.Final in Java agent, we haven't released java agent 8.9.0 yet

gRPC haven't had an official release for netty 4.1.68.Final yet (https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/issues/8617), we can upgrade but we also have to test (and undertake the risk) on our own, (we did this in OAP), what's your opinion? @wu-sheng
As this is a dependency CVE, I would like to keep it open for now. AFAIK, we don't have 8.9.0 release plan for short term..
This CVE belongs to gRPC, we would be better to wait and upgrade after they released or we need to do 8.9.0 agent release.
Thank you for your reply, I will temporarily install a secure version of the jar to use, and look forward to your update.
I think you may use a wrong milestone? That milestone should track issues for server side release.
Could you share what is the pattern of `AbstractBanyanDBDeserializer` about? I am sure this pattern is not being used in other storage implementation.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/72 gets no update.

> Could you share what is the pattern of `AbstractBanyanDBDeserializer` about? I am sure this pattern is not being used in other storage implementation.

The reason to introduce the `AbstractBanyanDBDeserializer` is that the storage build for BanyanDB is asymmetric, i.e. what we write is several lists of `SerializableTag`s while we read `TagAndValue` from database. Both of these lists are strictly ordered which should comply with the order of schema definition and the order of projection declaration.

Another motivation is that default implementation of `storageBuilder` within the DAO is less performant since binary data is always encoded to the base64 format which is not necessary in the case of BanyanDB. We natively support binary data format.

Besides, I suppose it is not necessary to fetch the full storage entity as an intermediate representation while querying. We could do the projection to reduce bandwidth usage.
Hi, I d like to fix this issue, please assign it to me.

> Hi, I d like to fix this issue, please assign it to me.

Done, please refer to precious PR, there are some edge case discussions there.

> > Hi, I d like to fix this issue, please assign it to me.
> 
> Done, please refer to precious PR, there are some edge case discussions there.

Which PR ?

> https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/72 gets no update.

This one.

This is how we tested. https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/tree/main/test/plugin/scenarios/kafka-scenario

You don't provide anything, we don't have responsibility to follow.

You should compare your case with existing test cases, and it is better to find out why NPE happens. 
Our plugins are contributed by hundreds of people globally, we are welcome the patch and enhancement for different cases, but we can't afford to debug for everyone.
Writing as async is the common case for all storage implementation. I am not sure what do you mean. All metrics/logs/traces in all storage implementations are async. Please check the exiting codes.

> Besides, I suppose it is not necessary to fetch the full storage entity as an intermediate representation while querying. We could do the projection to reduce bandwidth usage.

This is also unnecessary for query. We don't do that in other storage implementation too.

> Another motivation is that default implementation of storageBuilder within the DAO is less performant since binary data is always encoded to the base64 format which is not necessary in the case of BanyanDB. We natively support binary data format.

StorageBuilderFactory and StorageBuilder make sense to me to get rid of Map-based mechanism. My question is more about deserializer in query stage.

> > Besides, I suppose it is not necessary to fetch the full storage entity as an intermediate representation while querying. We could do the projection to reduce bandwidth usage.
> 
> This is also unnecessary for query. We don't do that in other storage implementation too.

I suppose at least IOTDB implementation is doing this?

> > Another motivation is that default implementation of storageBuilder within the DAO is less performant since binary data is always encoded to the base64 format which is not necessary in the case of BanyanDB. We natively support binary data format.
> 
> StorageBuilderFactory and StorageBuilder make sense to me to get rid of Map-based mechanism. My question is more about deserializer in query stage.

But the Map-based `storage2Entity`s are also doing base64 decoding, for example builders in `AlarmRecord`, `BrowserErrorLogRecord` etc.

> But the Map-based storage2Entitys are also doing base64 decoding, for example builders in AlarmRecord, BrowserErrorLogRecord etc.

Only builder did BASE64, I think we are clear builder should be override.

> I suppose at least IOTDB implementation is doing this?

This is the newest implementation. Why do you learn from it? BanyanDB DAO would be closest to core and native concept. You should not learn from IoTDB implementation.

> > But the Map-based storage2Entitys are also doing base64 decoding, for example builders in AlarmRecord, BrowserErrorLogRecord etc.
> 
> Only builder did BASE64, I think we are clear builder should be override.
> 
> > I suppose at least IOTDB implementation is doing this?
> 
> This is the newest implementation. Why do you learn from it? BanyanDB DAO would be closest to core and native concept. You should not learn from IoTDB implementation.

Well. It has been merged. So I guess it could be a referential impl.

I've checked JDBC impl again. I could understand what you meant. I could move the deserialization logic to the query DAO just as what we've done in JDBC, influxdb impl. Then we don't need to the deser abstraction.

> I've checked JDBC impl again. I could understand what you meant. I could move the deserialization logic to the query DAO just as what we've done in JDBC, influxdb impl. Then we don't need to the deser abstraction.

Most importantly, let's make Builder and BuilderFactory work to override the core. That is the most important.

> > I've checked JDBC impl again. I could understand what you meant. I could move the deserialization logic to the query DAO just as what we've done in JDBC, influxdb impl. Then we don't need to the deser abstraction.
> 
> Most importantly, let's make Builder and BuilderFactory work to override the core. That is the most important.

What about registering customized `StorageBuilderFactory` which can be done in the `prepare` stage of `ModuleProvider`.

By default, `new StorageBuilderFactory.Default()` is used.

> What about registering customized StorageBuilderFactory which can be done in the prepare stage of ModuleProvider.
By default, new StorageBuilderFactory.Default() is used.

Yes, we should override it through this way. Notice, this was designed and added by myself in the very beginning, but we never used in upstream in this way. Please let me know if this mechanism has an issue.

This is a little hard to tell. I can find this issue in demo env or  showcase. Have you checked the data in the database? 
I am going to move this to discussion until we know this is a bug.

Hello developer, 
when I use skywalking, I added the search term endpointName to the page named “trace”. Then I found that skywalking used to have this function, and it was removed in this version. Is this an entry span or exit span? I think entry span? As you mentioned behind the Nginx.
Yes, this is entry span
Then, you could skip this tag. Peer tag is only required in the exit span.
so  if REMOTE_PORT & REMOTE_ADDR exist add peer tag is fine.   Else just ignore
